firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and debuggability, adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence and Structural Segregation. User data, transactions, and payout requests are stored in separate collections, with user-owned data stored in hierarchical paths for clear ownership. The design avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies by using path-based ownership and, where needed, membership maps with denormalized roles. This approach ensures atomic operations and easy-to-debug security rules. All collections will share homogeneous security postures simplifying security rules and avoiding the mixing of data with different access needs in the same collection. QAPs are supported by using path-based ownership and role based access control. The design facilitates secure list operations using declarative rules without filtering.
